page.title: 11Chamber Farm - Water
page.content: One of the highest dairy farms in the country is to be found in Water. This is Chamber Farm owned and run by Mr. W. Feber. There are 102 acres devoted to hay meadows or rough grazing for the 80 cows and 24 sheep. There are also 1000 battery hens,these and the cows provide the greatest income for the farm. It is run entirely on modern principles with much machinery and needs only 2 people to keep it going. The buildings are a mixture of traditional stone and some modern additions. The farmhouse and long barn are 955ft above sea level and face SSW,the house is reputed to have been an overnight stop for John Wesley when preaching locally. The attached barn has a hay loft holding 40 tons and 2 shippens beneath,each milking and feeding 24 cows. There is a 200 gallon holding tank for the milk.
